testcase.classname: As an administrator or teacher, I want to update the information of the blog with the specified ID via an API connection.
testcase.name: When a PATCH request is sent to the /api/updateBlog/{id} endpoint with valid credentials and correct data,

failure.message: status code: 500, reason phrase: Internal Server Error

testcase.failure:
* The api user sends a POST request to the api "addBlog" endpoint to create a new "blog" record and records the "Added Blog ID" information..passed * The api user constructs the base url with the "admin" token...............passed * The api user sets "api/updateBlog" path parameters........................passed * The api user prepares a PATCH request to send to the api updateBlog endpoint with the "Online Education", 33, "Online education has rapidly evolved from a niche alternative to a mainstream method of learning." and "Accessibility Through MOOCs:Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs) pioneered accessible online learning, offering high-quality courses from prestigious universities to a global audience. Platforms like Coursera and edX made education more inclusive, breaking down geographical and financial barriers." information..passed * The api user sends a "PATCH" request and saves the returned response......failed * The api user verifies that the status code is 200.........................skipped * The api user verifies that the "remark" information in the response body is "success"..skipped * The api user verifies that the "Message" information in the response body is "Successfully Updated."..skipped * The api user verifies that the "Updated Blog Id" information in the returned response body is the same as the id path parameter written in the endpoint..skipped * The api user verifies that the "data.translations[0].title" is "Online Education" by sending a GET request to the "api" "blog" endpoint with the "Updated Blog Id" returned in the response body..skipped
